FC_ReturnCode _fc_addEntryToSortedBlobArray ( FC_SortedBlobArray *  sba,
int  idx,
void *  blob_p 
)

Add entry to a sorted blob array at the specified location.

Description:

Use this after you know where to put the new entry (usually use _fc_lookupBlobInSortedBlobArray).

NOTE! Make sure that use of this function does not violate the sorted and uniqueness of the sorted blob array!

Modifications:

  • 08/08/06 WSD Created.
Parameters:
sba  input/output - sortedBlobArray
idx  input - location to add the blob
blob_p  input - the pointer to the blob

FC_ReturnCode _fc_deleteEntryFromSortedBlobArray ( FC_SortedBlobArray *  sba,
int  idx 
)

Remove an entry at a specified location from a sorted blob array.

Description:

Use this after you know which entry you want to delete (usually use _fc_lookupBlobInSortedBlobArray).

This routine will fail if you try to delete an entry from an empty array.

Modifications:

  • 08/08/06 WSD Created.
Parameters:
sba  input/output - sortedBlobArray
idx  input - location to remove value

FC_ReturnCode _fc_expandBlobArray ( int *  length,
void ***  array 
)

Expand a blob array.

Description:

If length == 0, an array of length 1 is generated. If length > 0, then the array length is doubled. If length < 0, an error is generated.

Modifications:

  • 08/07/06 WSD Created.
Parameters:
length  input/output - length of the array
array  input/output - the array

Referenced by _fc_addEntryToSortedBlobArray().

01551

01553   if (!length || *length < 0 || !array) 
01554     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01555 
01556   // do it
01557   new_length = *length > 0 ? 2*(*length) : 1;
01558   if (*length == 0)  // malloc in case they didn't pass in NULL
01559     new_array = malloc(new_length*sizeof(void*));
01560   else 
01561     new_array = realloc(*array, new_length*sizeof(void*));
01562   if (!new_array) {
01563     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01564     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01565   }
01566  
01567   // return
01568   *length = new_length;
01569   *array = new_array;
01570   return FC_SUCCESS;
01571 }

FC_ReturnCode _fc_lookupBlobInSortedBlobArray ( FC_SortedBlobArray *  sba,
void *  blob,
int   blobCmp(const void *blob1, const void *blob2),
int *  foundBlob,
int *  idx 
)

Lookup blob in the sorted blob array.

Description:

Look for an blob in a sorted blob array using the provided compare function. A flag for whether a matching blob is found is returned in foundBlob (1 = found, 0 = not found). The index that the int is at (or would be at if it was in the array) is returned in idx.

This is implemented as binary search and should have average run time of O(log(sia->numVal)).

Modifications:

  • 06/06/06 ACG Created.
  • 07/13/06 WSD Separated binary search into it's own routine.
Parameters:
sba  input - sortedIntArray
blob  input - blob to lookup
blobCmp  input - the compare function
foundBlob  output - 1 if find blob, or 0
idx  output - the index if blob is found, or the index the blob would have been at

Definition at line 1591 of file storage.c.

References FC_SortedBlobArray::blobs, FC_INPUT_ERROR, fc_isSortedBlobArrayValid(), FC_SUCCESS, and FC_SortedBlobArray::numBlob.

Referenced by _fc_buildEdgeConns(), _fc_buildFaceConns(), fc_addBlobToSortedBlobArray(), fc_deleteBlobFromSortedBlobArray(), and fc_isBlobInSortedBlobArray().

01599  {
01600   int low, high, mid, cmpVal;
01601 
01602   // default returns
01603   if (foundBlob)
01604     *foundBlob = -1;
01605   if (idx)
01606     *idx = -1;
01607 
01608   // check arguments
01609   //?FIX could blob be null?
01610   if (!fc_isSortedBlobArrayValid(sba) || !blob || !blobCmp || !foundBlob ||
01611       !idx) {
01612     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01613   }
01614 
01615   // early return
01616   if (sba->numBlob < 1) {
01617     *foundBlob = 0;
01618     *idx = 0;
01619     return FC_SUCCESS;
01620   }
01621 
01622   // binary search
01623   low = 0;
01624   high = sba->numBlob-1;
01625   while (low <= high) {
01626     mid = (low+high)/2;
01627     cmpVal = blobCmp((const void*)blob, (const void*)sba->blobs[mid]);
01628     if (cmpVal == 0) {
01629       *foundBlob = 1;
01630       *idx = mid;
01631       return FC_SUCCESS;
01632     } else if (cmpVal < 0) { // blob is before mid
01633       high = mid-1;
01634     } else {
01635       low = mid+1;
01636     }
01637   }
01638 
01639   // no match
01640   *foundBlob = 0;
01641   *idx = (cmpVal < 0 ? mid : mid+1);
01642   return FC_SUCCESS;
01643 }

FC_ReturnCode _fc_lookupIntInSortedIntArray ( FC_SortedIntArray *  sia,
int  i,
int *  foundInt,
int *  idx 
)

Lookup int in the sorted int array.

Description:

Look for an int in a sorted int array. A flag for whether the int is found is returned in foundInt (1 = found, 0 = not found). The index that the int is at (or would be at if it was in the array) is returned in idx.

This is implemented as binary search and should have average run time of O(log(sia->numVal)).

Modifications:

  • 06/06/06 ACG Created.
  • 07/13/06 WSD Separated binary search into it's own routine.
Parameters:
sia  input - sortedIntArray
i  input - int to lookup
foundInt  output - 1 if find int, or 0
idx  output - the index if int is found, or the index the int would have been at
